Struggle of Workers' Party of Korea Supported
articles.content:
Struggle of Workers' Party of Korea Supported 
    Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Wisal Farha Bagdash, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Syria, said that his party will always express solidarity with the struggle of the Workers' Party of Korea for justice.
 When meeting with Kim Pyong Nam, DPRK ambassador e.p. to Syria, who paid a courtesy call on him on April 13, the general secretary said that the Syrian people have the deep feelings of reverence for President Kim Il Sung and highly praise his immortal exploits.    
 Noting that the Korean people's struggle serves as a model of struggle against imperialism for the world progressives, he said that the victory of Korea is its own victory.

articles.title: Joint Ground Drill of S. Korean Army
articles.content:
Joint Ground Drill of S. Korean Army 
    Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The Metropolitan Defence Command of the south Korean army began a joint ground drill for 2004 in the whole area of Seoul on April 19, according to the south Korean KBS.
 It was reported that the drill, an annual event under the cloak of "improvement of the joint action capacity of civilian-government officials-army combined defence operations," would last till May 1.

articles.title: Floral Baskets Laid before Portraits of President Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Floral Baskets Laid before Portraits of President Kim Il Sung 
    Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Functions of laying floral baskets before the portraits of President Kim Il Sung took place at the Organization of Solidarity of the Peoples of Africa, Asia and Latin America and at Kim Il Sung Economic Special School in Cuba separately on April 14 on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
 Present were officials of the organisation, the headmaster, teachers and students of the school, the secretary general of the Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, the DPRK ambassador e. p. and staff members of the embassy in Havana.    
 The participants laid floral baskets before the portraits of the President and made a bow to him.

Stone Donated to Monument to Three Charters for National Reunification
articles.content:
Stone Donated to Monument to Three Charters for National Reunification
    Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The French Group for the Study of the Juche Idea sent a commemorative stone to the Monument to the Three Charters for National Reunification. It was conveyed to an official concerned on April 19 by Jean Marie Lambret, head of the delegation of the study group on a visit to the DPRK on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
 Referring to the fact that the Korean people have undergone sufferings resulting from the national division imposed upon them by foreign forces, the head said that historic meeting of the top leaders of the north and south of Korea was held and the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration, a landmark of Korea's reunification, published thanks to the unbounded magnanimity of leader Kim Jong Il.    
 He expressed the hope that the reunification of Korea would be achieved independently and peacefully at an early date.

S. Korean Delegation Here
    Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the south Korean Red Cross led by President Ri Yun Gu arrived here today.
 It was met at the airport with compatriotic feelings by Choe Song Ik, permanent member of the Central Committee of the Red Cross Society of the DPRK, and officials concerned.

articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Outgoing Indian Ambassador
    Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Chairman Choe Thae Bok of the Supreme People's Assembly of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea met and had a talk with Rich Pal Singh, Indian ambassador to the DPRK who paid a farewell call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
